lines.text: I hate you and I despise you! Now give me back my tail!
I just got to feel that whoever I marry has some real regard for me, aside from all that lovin' stuff.
Well I had to do something, he was making a fuss in front of all those people.
Well, I've been thinkin' about them other fellas, Cherry. And well, what I mean is, I like you the way you are, so what do I care how you got that way?
Bo!
[crying]
That's the sweetest, tenderest thing anyone ever said to me.
I still wish you was goin' back to the ranch with me more than anything I know.
You do?
Yeah, I do.
I'd go anywhere in the world with you now. Anywhere at all!
Here, somebody hold this thing for me
[about a steer he'd just wrestled this to the ground]
[last lines]
Bye, everybody! Bye! Bye.
Wait! I haven't put my lipstick on yet!

My name is Beauregard Decker, ma'am. I am 21 years old and I own my own ranch up in Timber Hill, Montana, where I got a fine herd of Hereford cattle, a dozen horses and the finest sheep and hogs and chickens in the country. Now I come down for the rodeo tomorrow with the idea in mind to find me a angel and you're it. Now I don't have a whole lot of time for sweet talkin' around the bush so I would be much obliged if you would just step outside with me into the fresh air.
What'd you say?
My name if Beauregard Decker, ma'am. I am 21 years old and I own my own ranch up in Timber Hill, Montana, where I got a fine...
I know. I heard all that part...
O.K. Let's get out of here!
I'm mighty grateful for what you did but we're not allowed to go out with the customers. But you can buy me a drink if you want to. I'm so dry I'm spittin' cotton.
Virg.
Yeah, Beau.
What's the difference between a... a physical attraction and, well, just a regular attraction.
Well, a gal can be attracted to a fella, oh, lots of reasons. His mind, for instance.
His mind?
Sure. He could be smart or read poetry or something.
No kiddin'.
That's right.
I can read and write.
Hmmm.
But I don't know no poetry. But I can recite the Gettysburg address. Would that count?
It might, Beau. I doubt it, but it might.
[first lines]
Are you ready, Virge?
Anytime.
Turn him out!
[calf is released from chute]
